link.title: Newbury Elementary School - News

form.name: aspnetForm

span.p: The Newbury Administration, staff, and students would like to thank HOPE FOR KIDS GEAUGA for their generous donation to provide Hot Spots for our students during our virtual learning while school has been closed. Their kindness and support have greatly benefited our school and community. We appreciate their outreach to provide needed opportunities to our students.
Thank you! Go Black Knights! PLEASE BE SAFE!

div.a: School Tours are Cancelled until Further Notice

span.p: All school tours that were scheduled in April and May are cancelled until further notice. Please check back to the website for any updated school news.

span.p: All Staff and students will be receiving one of these shirts from the school.

If you would also like to purchase one, we have a limited number for sale. Short Sleeves are $15 and long sleeves are $22. We have adult sizes from small to 3XL. Please email mary.dolence@newburyschools.org if you would like to purchase one.

Juniors: Get a Jump-Start on your Senior Year on May 13, 2020 at 6:30 p.m. LEAF will be holding a Virtual Resource Center Session online for high school juniors and their parents. Hear about the college application process senior timeline, and things to look for when visiting a college. Learn how and when to apply for admissions and financial aid. Register at https://leaf-ohio.org/resource-center-sessions/
Lights on for seniors - April 20, 2020 at 8:20 pm

div.p: Newbury Schools aims to be vigilant and proactive about the spread of diseases and germs.

ul.li: We disinfect and clean our buildings and buses thoroughly during this cold-flu season anyway.
PA Announcements on a daily basis for the next few weeks.
Nurse Cavanaugh will visit classrooms to demonstrate proper handwashing technique.
Encourage our students to use hand sanitizer stations during the day.
Encouraging our sick students and staff to stay home.
Continuing to track attendance to remain aware of trends.
Our administrators are attending regional informational meetings on the coronavirus so we stay up to date on safety measures.
